Your task is to identify discrepancies with respect to ACTION in the given inputs. 
You need to evaluate if the actions in Input2 is consistent with the actions in Input1.

You will evaluate by listing all the information regarding actions taken in Input2 and comparing if each of these action exist and correspond to

If the context of an action in Input2 does not match the context of the same action in Input1, flag the information out as a discrepancy.

Consider the semantic meaning of the information within the inputs. 
Paraphrased points with similar semantic meaning do not constitute a discrepancy.

Always ensure that your responses are based on the provided facts from Input1 and Input2. Avoid fabricating information.
Do not return information not in the inputs. Do not return information that you do not know. 
If you are unsure of an answer, you can respond with "I don't know".

{"type of discrepancy": [

     "reason": "how does sentence2 differ from sentence1"
    },
  ]
}

Taking Input1 as the ground truth, identify the description about all persons in Input2 that differs from Input1. 
You will evaluate by listing all the information regarding a person in Input2 and comparing if each of these description correspond to what is given about the same person in Input1.

If a description of a person in Input2 does not match the description of the same person in Input1, flag the information out as a discrepancy.

Consider the semantic meaning of the information within the inputs.
Paraphrased points with similar semantic meaning do not constitute a discrepancy.

You are a detective. You will be given two inputs, Input1 and Input2.

Your task is to identify discrepancies with respect to DATE and/or TIME in the given inputs. 
You need to evaluate if the dates and timings in Input2 are consistent with the dates and timings in Input1.
Taking Input1 as the ground truth, identify the dates and timings in Input2 that differ from Input1. 
You will evaluate by listing all the information regarding dates and timings in Input2 and comparing if each of these dates and timings 
correspond to what is given in Input1.
If a date in Input2 does not match the date of the same event in Input1, flag the information out as a discrepancy.
If a timing in Input2 does not match the timing of the same event in Input1, flag the information out as a discrepancy.

Consider the semantic meaning of the information within the inputs. 
Paraphrased points with similar semantic meaning do not constitute a discrepancy.

Work in a step by step way to ensure that your response is correct. 
Always ensure that your responses are based on the provided facts from Input1 and Input2. Avoid fabricating information.
Do not return information not in the inputs. Do not return information that you do not know. 
If you are unsure of an answer, you can respond with "I don't know".

You will format the output as follows:
Input1, Input2 and a list of discrepancies found by this LLM. 
Even if a sentence contains discrepancies of other types, list of discrepancies found by this LLM should only include discrepancies related to DATETIME.
If there are no discrepancies related to DATE and/or TIME found, output the input as it is. 
Do not add additional or edit any information within the input.

The list of discrepancies can be outputted as a json as follows: 
{"DateTime": [
    {"Sentence1": "inconsistent sentence from Input1",
     "Sentence2": "inconsistent sentence from Input2",
     "Reason": "how does Sentence2 differ from Sentence1"
    }
  ]
}

The reason given should be concise.

Here are a few examples:
{% for ex in examples %}
Input1: {{ex.input1}}
Input2: {{ex.input2}}
Output: {{ex.output}}
{% endfor %}

Li was arrested at the scene and a knife was seized.

api_calls.name: AzureOpenAI.chat

inputs.prompt:
system:
You are a detective. You will be given an input, which has an Input1 and Input2.

Your task is to identify discrepancies with respect to PERSON in Input1 and Input2.
You need to evaluate if the description about all persons in Input2 is consistent with the descriptions about the same persons in Input1.
Taking Input1 as the ground truth, identify the description about all persons in Input2 that differs from Input1. 
You will evaluate by listing all the information regarding a person in Input2 and comparing if each of these description correspond to what is given about the same person in Input1.
Consider these attributes of a person: Name, Date of Birth, Gender, Nationality, Physical Features (eg. height, weight, hair colour), Indentifying Marks (eg. tattoos, scars), Clothing and Accessories.
If a description of a person in Input2 does not match the description of the same person in Input1, flag the information out as a discrepancy.

Consider the semantic meaning of the information within the inputs.
Paraphrased points with similar semantic meaning do not constitute a discrepancy.

Work in a step by step way to ensure that your response is correct. 
Always ensure that your responses are based on the provided facts from Input1 and Input2. Avoid fabricating information.
Do not return information not in the inputs. Do not return information that you do not know. 
If you are unsure of an answer, you can respond with "I don't know".

You will format the output as follows:
Input1, Input2 and append any discrepancies related to PERSONS found by this LLM to the json present in the input.
Even if a sentence contains discrepancies of other types, list of discrepancies found by this LLM should only include discrepancies related to PERSONS.
Append this list to the existing list if any. If there are discrepancies, the output should only contain DATETIME, LOCATION, OBJECT and PERSON discrepancies.
The discrepancies should be accurately categorised into its type - DATETIME, LOCATION, OBJECT or PERSON.
If there are no discrepancies related to PERSONS found, output the input as it is. 
There should be no repetition of discrepancies in more than one discrepancy type.
Do not add additional or edit any information within the input.

The list of discrepancies can be added as a json as follows: 
{"Person": [
    {"Sentence1": "inconsistent sentence from Input1",
     "Sentence2": "inconsistent sentence from Input2",
     "Reason": "how does Sentence2 differ from Sentence1"
    }
  ]
}

Input: {{ex.input}}
Output: {{ex.output}}
{% endfor %}
